DOC.brief_summary: The focus project use transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation ( TENS ) novel indication treat neuromuscular activation individual knee osteoarthritis ( OA ) exhibit neuromuscular activation deficit . The overall goal improve outcomes associate traditional therapeutic exercise ( TE ) develop enhance rehabilitation strategy , augments TE TENS ( TENS+TE ) , purpose treat underlie neuromuscular activation deficit . The investigator seek use TENS excite neural pathway immediately increase neuromuscular activation well cause sustained improvement neuromuscular activation great strength gain knee OA patient compare traditional TE . The investigator evaluate effect TENS+TE muscle strength , neuromuscular activation , gait biomechanics , physical function , physical activity , self-efficacy physical activity , self-reported quality life , disability pain . The central hypothesis enhance TENS+TE intervention lead well clinical outcome , increase physical activity , improve general health . The rationale conduct small clinical trial , demonstrate feasibility establishes preliminary effect enhance rehabilitation strategy , ultimately inform development future large clinical trial establish efficacy enhanced rehabilitation strategy knee OA . This hypothesis test two specific aim : 1 ) collect report data feasibility conduct clinical trial evaluate efficacy use TENS+TE compare sham TENS+TE TE treat patient knee OA clinical setting , 2 ) determine preliminary effect 4-week TENS+TE intervention compare sham TENS+TE , TE muscle strength , neuromuscular activation , gait biomechanics , physical function , physical activity , self-efficacy physical activity , self report quality life , disability , pain knee OA patient . Posttests 4 8-weeks follow baseline .
DOC.brief_title: The KNEEhabilitation Study : Improving Disability Individuals With Knee Osteoarthritis
DOC.criteria: All knee OA participant must exhibit symptomatic knee OA , define normalize , person base , Western Ontario McMaster Universities Arthritis Index ( WOMAC ) function subscale score > 31 ( 100 point , indicate dysfunction ) ,38 radiographic evidence tibiofemoral OA ( 24 Kellgren Lawrence scale ) 39 neuromuscular activation deficit , define quadriceps neuromuscular activation le 90 % involve leg.3 Participants age 40 75 year old include . Patients also exclude : 1 ) diagnose cardiovascular condition restrict exercise ; 2 ) corticosteroid hyaluronic acid injection involve knee previous 6months ; 3 ) pacemaker ; 4 ) neurodegenerative condition ; 5 ) rheumatoid arthritis ; 6 ) cancer ; 7 ) neural sensory dysfunction knee 8 ) BMI 35 ; 9 ) history low extremity orthopaedic surgery past year ; 10 ) history traumatic knee injury past 6 month ; 11 ) history total knee arthroplasty either extremity ; 12 ) diagnose , nonreconstructed knee ligament tear . Patients need assistive device walk pregnant female also exclude .
